step.tex: A\cdot B = I, \\ \text{where I is identity matrix.}
step.reason: \text{If A and B are square matrices such that B} \\ \text{is the inverse of A, then A is also the inverse} \\ \text{of B and their product is the identity matrix.} \\ AB = BA = I

step.context: \text{If }A= \left[\begin{array}{rr} 2 & 3 \\ 5 & -2 \end{array}\right], B= \left[\begin{array}{rr} a & b \\ c & d \end{array}\right] \text{and }AB=I \\ \text{where I is the identity matrix then the following} \\ \text{equations hold}
step.reason: \left[\begin{array}{rr} 2 & 3 \\ 5 & -2 \end{array}\right]\cdot \left[\begin{array}{rr} a & b \\ c & d \end{array}\right]= \left[\begin{array}{rr} 2a+3c & 2b+3d \\ 5a-2c & 5b-2d \end{array}\right] \\ \text{Identity Matrix }I= \left[\begin{array}{rr} 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 1 \end{array}\right] \text{therefore,}\\ \begin{align} 2a+3c=1 \quad & 2b+3d=0 \\ 5a-2c=0 \quad & 5b-2d=1 \end{align} \\ \text{on solving }\\ a=\dfrac{2}{19},b=\dfrac{3}{19}, c=\dfrac{5}{19}\text{ and}d=\dfrac{-2}{19}
